expericence.title: Over 40 years of business experience
expericence.info: Since 1979, we have been taking on full and partial loads, optimizing their composition and distributing the shipments to their respective destinations with selected vetted carriers.

partner.title: Neutral partner
partner.info: From the very beginning, it has been our company's philosophy to act exclusively as a neutral forwarder for other haulage companies and to specialise in truck transport.

sustainable.title: One partner for all subjects
sustainable.info: We not only bring your consignment to its destination but also check all loading equipment movements. Moreover we ensure timely repatriation in case of loading equipment debts. Should damage ever occur, any claims for compensation are processed immediately. In the case of complex damage events, we cooperate here with our subsidiary GSS Güter-Schaden-Service GmbH.

specialty.title: Specialist in truck transports
specialty.info: As a specialist we are better than the global provider - to your advantage. Every day we load about 1,200 trucks, dispatched from 33 NEUFRA branches in Europe.

direct-transportation.title: Direct transport without reloading
direct-transportation.info: Your shipments are transported directly to the recipient without reloading, so that they reach the desired destination quickly and reliably with minimized risk of damage.

shipment-tracking.title: Tracking on request
shipment-tracking.info: We will accompany your shipment until it has been unloaded at the recipient's premises. If you wish, you can receive status updates from us at any time.

digitalisation-partner.title: Partner for a digital future
digitalisation-partner.info: With our EDP team, we are always developing our programs. With Colleto, we will drive the path of digitalization.

history.title: History
history.first: What started on 01.01.1979 with a total of 5 people, has developed into an internationally positioned freight forwarding service provider with more than 400 employees in 33 branches in Europe.
history.second: The main focus in the eighties was the establishment of a nationwide network of branches in the old Federal Republic of Germany in order to meet the growing demands of forwarding customers. After the political turnaround in 1989, NEUFRA-Spedition also expanded into the new federal states. Parallel to the expansion of the German branch network, in the 1990s the strategic decision was made to develop NEUFRA into a European freight forwarding company. As a consequence, subsidiaries were founded in Italy and Hungary.
history.third: After the turn of the millennium, subsidiaries followed in Austria, Poland, Spain and the Czech Republic. Currently, of course, digitization is also playing a special role. Not only administrative processes have been and are being digitally simplified for NEUFRA and its business partners, but also the development of its own web application and app for freight management secure the future of the NEUFRA Group in the digital age.

locations.info: Our dense network of branches ensures the greatest possible geographical proximity to our business partners. For detailed information on relations and contact persons, simply click on a NEUFRA branch on the map.

national.title: National services
national.info: Through our dense network of branches in Germany, we realize your partial or full load in daily scheduled transport.

european.title: Europe-wide transports
european.info: Whether within the national territories of our European neighbors or beyond their borders, we are the right contact.

international.title: International transports
international.info: We also transport your goods outside the borders of Europe. You can find our experts for the Middle East at our branch in Frankfurt, for example.

temperatureControlled.title: Temperature-controlled transports
temperatureControlled.info: You can find our specialists for temperature-controlled transports at our branch in Leipzig.

dangerGoodss.title: Dangerous Goods Transports
dangerGoodss.info: Of course, we also transport your dangerous goods to all destinations by arrangement.

info.pr1: Our employees are the basis of our company. Therefore, we are always looking for motivated new colleagues. Experienced dispatchers are the guarantor for quality and growth and are welcome to take on the challenge of independently handling a traffic relation.
info.pr2: Feel free to browse our current job offers, applications can be sent directly to the corresponding branch.
info.pr3: Are you interested in training at NEUFRA? Here you can find our training offers for:
info.pr4: Management Assistant for Freight Forwarding and Logistic Services

spedition.title: Management Assistant for Freight Forwarding and Logistic Services
spedition.pr1: The NEUFRA Group is an internationally positioned medium-sized company that specialises in truck transport. Every day we load approx. 1200 trucks, dispatched from 33 NEUFRA branches in Europe. Since 1979, we have been taking on full and part loads and optimising their composition.
spedition.pr2: During your training as a Management Assistant for Freight Forwarding and Logistic Services, you will get to know the many facets of scheduling. New tasks and challenges await you every day when purchasing, planning and selling transport services, which all of us, including our experienced dispatchers, master together as a team. Of course, your training will combine the specifics of freight forwarding with the general commercial areas of administration and accounting.
spedition.li5: like to make decisions on your own responsibility and
spedition.li6: keep an overview even in stressful situations,
spedition.pr4: then training at NEUFRA is the right choice for you.
spedition.pr5: You can expect an open corporate culture with flat hierarchies in a personalised working environment. Your everyday working life will take place in a modern environment in which the majority of the process steps are already fully digitalised. We offer you a future-proof workplace with the goal of a long-term collaboration.
spedition.pr6: Did we arouse your interest? Then get in touch with us, we offer this vocational training at all our locations and look forward to receiving your application to the relevant branch management.

management.title: Management Assistant for Office Communication
management.pr1: The NEUFRA Group is an internationally positioned medium-sized company that specialises in truck transport. Every day we load approx. 1200 trucks, dispatched from 33 NEUFRA branches in Europe. Since 1979, we have been taking on full and part loads and optimising their composition.
management.pr2: The training for Management Assistant for Office Communication is characterised by its diverse fields of learning. After the first year of training, you will therefore deepen your knowledge in two of a total of ten optional qualifications. Since you will have many points of contact with the topics of the forwarding industry during your training at NEUFRA, you should also be interested in the world of logistics.
management.li1: take pleasure in working with figures,
management.li3: work in a thorough and structured manner,
management.pr4: then training at NEUFRA is the right choice for you.
management.pr5: You can expect an open corporate culture with flat hierarchies in a personalised working environment. Your everyday working life will take place in a modern environment in which the majority of the process steps are already fully digitalised. We offer you a future-proof workplace with the goal of a long-term collaboration.
management.pr6: Did we arouse your interest? Then contact us; we offer this vocational training at our locations in Deggendorf, Frankfurt, Munich, Neuss and Nuremberg. Please send your application documents to the relevant branch management.

capacityExploitation.title: Are you looking for optimal capacity utilization for your vehicles?
capacityExploitation.info: Then let's talk individually about a collaboration tailored for both parties. All points will be agreed with you, from the number of loading and unloading points to the destination and freight price.

cooperation.title: Are you interested in working together as partners?
cooperation.info: Our goal is a long-term business relationship with planning reliability for both sides, because reliable business partners are the be-all and end-all in our industry.

interest.title: Did we arouse your interest?
interest.info: Then get in touch with us; just contact the branch nearest you.

legalNotice.info: The information on these web pages has been carefully compiled. Despite all care, errors can occur. Therefore, we expressly point out that we do not assume any liability or guarantee for the completeness, topicality and correctness of this information provided. We also assume no liability or guarantee for the content of external links. The operators of the linked pages are solely responsible for their content. All users agree that use of the website is at their own risk.

dataPrivacy.responsible: I. Name and address of the data controller
dataPrivacy.responsibleInfo: The data controller in the definition of the EU General Data Protection Regulation and other, national data protection laws of the Member States as well as further data protection regulations is:
dataPrivacy.dataprotectionOfficer: II. Name and Address of the Data Protection Officer
dataPrivacy.dataprotectionOfficerInfo: The Data Protection Officer of the data controller is:
dataPrivacy.dataprocessing: III. General remarks on data precession
dataPrivacy.dataprocessingSection1: 1. Scope of the processing of personal data
dataPrivacy.dataprocessingSection1Info: In general personal data are only processed if it’s necessary for the provision of fully functional website as well as our contents and services.
dataPrivacy.dataprocessingSection2: 2. Legal basis for the data processing
dataPrivacy.dataprocessingSection2Info: The legal basis for the data possession is Art. 6 (1) lit. f) GDPR, if processing is necessary for the purposes of the legitimate interests pursued by the controller or by a third party and where such interests are not overridden by the interests or fundamental rights and freedoms of the data subject.
dataPrivacy.dataprocessingSection3: 3. Deletion and Duration of the storing
dataPrivacy.dataprocessingSection3Info: Personal data of the data subject will be deleted as soon as the purpose of the data procession ceases to exist.
dataPrivacy.website: IV. Provision of the website and creation of logfiles
dataPrivacy.websiteSection1: 1. Description and scope of data processing
dataPrivacy.websiteSection1Info1: On retrieval of our website, our system automatically gathers data and information from the computer system of the accessing computer. The following data is gathered in this process:
dataPrivacy.websiteSection1Sub1: Information on the browser type and the version used
dataPrivacy.websiteSection1Sub5: Data and time of the access
dataPrivacy.websiteSection1Sub6: Websites from which the user’s system reaches our website
dataPrivacy.websiteSection1Sub7: Websites that are called up by the user’s system via our website
dataPrivacy.websiteSection1Info2: The data will likewise be stored in the logfiles of our system. The user’s IP address or other data which allow an assignment of the data to the user are not affected hereby. This data will also not be stored together with other personal data of the user.
dataPrivacy.websiteSection2: 2. Legal basis for the data processing
dataPrivacy.websiteSection2Info: The legal basis for the temporary storing of the data and logfiles is Art. 6 (1) lit. f) GDPR.
dataPrivacy.websiteSection3Info: The temporary storing of the IP address by the system is necessary to enable a delivery of the website to the computer of the user. For this purpose, the user’s IP address must remain stored for the duration of the session.
dataPrivacy.websiteSection4Info: The data will be deleted, as soon as it is no longer needed to achieve the purpose for gathering it. This will be the case when the respective session is ended in the case that data is gathered for the purpose of providing this website.
dataPrivacy.websiteSection5Info: The gathering of the data for the purpose of providing the website and the storing of the data in logfiles is necessarily required for the operation of the website. Consequently, there is no possibility to object for the user.
dataPrivacy.rightsInfo: If personal data of you is processed, you are a data subject in the definition of the GDPR and you have the rights listed below in relation to the data controller.
dataPrivacy.rightsSection1Info1: You can demand a confirmation from the data controller of whether personal data relating to you is being processed by us. If such processing applies, you can demand information from the data controller regarding the following aspects:
dataPrivacy.rightsSection1Sub1: the purposes for which the personal data is processed;
dataPrivacy.rightsSection1Sub2: the categories of personal data that is processed;
dataPrivacy.rightsSection1Sub3: the recipients or categories of recipients to whom personal data relating to you has been disclosed or will be disclosed in the future;
dataPrivacy.rightsSection1Sub4: the planned duration of the storing of the personal data relating to you or, if this cannot be specified concretely, the criteria for determining the storage duration;
dataPrivacy.rightsSection1Sub5: applicability of a right to correction or deletion of the personal data relating to you, a right to restrict the processing by the data controller or a right to object to this processing;
dataPrivacy.rightsSection1Sub6: applicability of a right to complain with a supervisory authority;
dataPrivacy.rightsSection1Sub7: all available information on the origin of the data if the personal data has not been gathered from the data subject;
dataPrivacy.rightsSection1Sub8: applicability of an automated decision-making process including profiling according to Art. 22 (1) and (4) GDPR and – at least in these cases – explanatory information about the involved logic and scope, as well as the intended effects for the data subject from such processing.
dataPrivacy.rightsSection1Info2: You have the right to demand information of whether the personal data relating to you is being transmitted to a third country or an international organisation. In this connection, you can request being informed about the suitable guarantees according to Art. 46 GDPR relating to the transmission.
dataPrivacy.rightsSection2Info: You have a right to the correction and/or completion in relation to the data controller, insofar as the processed personal data relating to you is incorrect or incomplete. The data controller has to make the correction without delay.
dataPrivacy.rightsSection3Info1: On the following conditions, you can request the limitation of the processing of personal data relating to you:
dataPrivacy.rightsSection3Sub1: If you deny the correctness of the personal data relating to you for a period that enables the data controller to check the correctness of the personal data;
dataPrivacy.rightsSection3Sub2: the processing is illegitimate and you reject the deletion of the personal data, and instead request the limitation of the use of the personal data;
dataPrivacy.rightsSection3Sub3: the data controller no longer needs the personal data for the purposes of the processing, but you require it for the assertion, exercise or defence of legal claims; or
dataPrivacy.rightsSection3Sub4: if you have raised an objection against the processing according to Art. 1 GDPR and if it is not certain yet if the justified interests of the data controller outweigh your reasons.
dataPrivacy.rightsSection3Info2: If the processing of the personal data relating to you has been limited, this data may be processed – other than for storing – only with your consent or only to assert, exercise or defend legal claims or to protect the rights of another natural person or legal entity, or for reasons of a compelling public interest of the European Union or of a Member State. If the limitation of the processing has been applied according to the aforementioned conditions, you will be informed by the data controller before the limitation is lifted.
dataPrivacy.rightsSection4aInfo: You can demand from the data controller that the personal data relating to you is to be deleted immediately and the data controller will be obligated to delete this data immediately if one of the following reasons applies:
dataPrivacy.rightsSection4aSub1: The personal data relating to you is no longer required for the purposes for which it has been gathered or otherwise processed.
dataPrivacy.rightsSection4aSub2: You revoke your consent that served as the basis for the processing according to Art. 6 (1) lit. a) or Art. 9 (2) lit. a) GDPR and there is no other legal basis for the processing.
dataPrivacy.rightsSection4aSub3: You raise an objection according to Art. 21 (1) GDPR against the processing and there are no outweighing justified reasons for the processing, or you object to the processing according to Art. 21 (2) GDPR.
dataPrivacy.rightsSection4aSub4: The personal data relating to you is processed illegitimately.
dataPrivacy.rightsSection4aSub5: The deletion of the personal data relating to you is required to fulfil a legal obligation according to EU law or the laws of the Member States that apply to the data controller.
dataPrivacy.rightsSection4aSub6: The personal data relating to you has been gathered with regard to offered services of the information society according to Art. 8 (1) GDPR.
dataPrivacy.rightsSection4bInfo: If the data controller has made the personal data relating to you publicly accessible and if it is obligated to delete it according to Art. 17 (1) GDPR, it will take appropriate measures, also of technical nature, in consideration of the available technology and implementation costs, in order to inform the parties, who are responsible for the data processing and who process the personal data, of the fact that you, as the data subject, have requested them to delete all links to this personal data or copies or replications of this personal data.
dataPrivacy.rightsSection4cInfo: The right to deletion does not apply if the processing is required
dataPrivacy.rightsSection4cSub1: to exercise the right to free speech and information;
dataPrivacy.rightsSection4cSub2: to fulfil a legal obligation that applies to the processing pursuant to EU law or the laws of the Member States that apply to data controller, or to fulfil a task in the public interest or in exercise of public power that has been delegated to the data controller;
dataPrivacy.rightsSection4cSub3: for reasons of the public interest in matters of public health according to Art. 9 (2) lit. h) and i) as well as Art. 9 (3) GDPR;
dataPrivacy.rightsSection4cSub4: for archiving purposes that are in the public interest, for scientific or historic research purposes or for statistical purposes according to Art. 89 (1) GDPR, insofar as the right referred to under Section a) is expected to render the realisation of the processing objectives impossible or obstructs it to significant extent; or
dataPrivacy.rightsSection4cSub5: for the assertion, exercise or defence of legal claims.
dataPrivacy.rightsSection5Info: If you have asserted the right to the correction, deletion or limitation of the processing against the data controller, it will be obligated to inform all recipients to whom personal data relating to you has been disclosed of this correction or deletion of this data or the limitation of the processing, unless this proves to be impossible or if such is tied to disproportionate effort or expense. You have the right in relation to the data controller to be informed of these recipients.
dataPrivacy.rightsSection6Info1: You have the right to receive the personal data relating to you that you have made available to the data controller in a structured, common and machine-readable format. You have furthermore the right to transmit this data to another data controller without obstruction by the data controller to whom the personal data has been made available, insofar as
dataPrivacy.rightsSection6Sub1: the processing is based on a consent according to Art. 6 (1) lit. a) GDPR or Art. 9 (2) lit. a) GDPR or a contract according to Art. 6 (1) lit. b) GDPR, and
dataPrivacy.rightsSection6Sub2: the processing takes place by means of automated processes.
dataPrivacy.rightsSection6Info2: In exercise of this right, you moreover have the right to effect that the personal data relating to you is transmitted directly from one data controller to another data controller insofar as this is technically practicable. Freedoms and rights of other persons must not be impaired thereby. The right to data portability does not apply to the processing of personal data that is required to fulfil a task in the public interest or in exercise of public power that has been delegated to the data controller.
dataPrivacy.rightsSection7Info: You have the right to object at any time, for reasons that result from your particular situation, to the processing of the personal data relating to you that takes place on the basis of Art. 6 (1) lit. e) or lit. f) GDPR; this also applies to profiling based on these provisions. The data controller will cease the processing of the personal data relating to you, unless it can prove compelling reasons for the processing that qualify for protection and which outweigh your interests, rights and freedoms, or if the processing serves the purpose of asserting, exercising or defending against legal claims. If the personal data relating to you is processed to operate direct marketing, you have the right to object at any time to the processing of the personal data relating to you for the purpose of such advertising; this also applies to profiling if it is connected to such direct marketing. If you object to the processing for the purposes of direct marketing, the personal data relating to you will no longer be processed for these purposes. You have the option to exercise your right to object in connection with the use of the services of the information society – notwithstanding Directive 2002/58/EC – by means of automated procedures, in which technical specifications are used.
dataPrivacy.rightsSection8: 8. Right to revoke the consent according to data protection laws
dataPrivacy.rightsSection8Info: You have the right to revoke your consent according to data protection laws at any time. The legitimacy of the processing that has taken place up until your objection will not be affected by the revocation of the consent.
dataPrivacy.rightsSection9: 9. Automated decision in the individual case including profiling
dataPrivacy.rightsSection9Info1: You have the right not to be subjected to a decision that is exclusively based on automated processing – including profiling – which develops legal effect in relation to you or which causes similar significant obstructions for you. This does not apply if the decision
dataPrivacy.rightsSection9Sub1: is required for the conclusion or the fulfilment of a contract concluded between you and the data controller;
dataPrivacy.rightsSection9Sub2: is permissible based on the legal regulations of the EU or the Member States that apply to the data controller and if these legal regulations contain appropriate measures to protect your rights and freedoms as well as your justified interests; or
dataPrivacy.rightsSection9Sub3: is made with your explicit agreement.
dataPrivacy.rightsSection9Info2: However, these decisions may not be based on special categories of personal data pursuant to Art. 9 (1) GDPR, unless Art. 9 (2) lit. a) or lit. g) applies and appropriate measures for the protection of rights and freedoms as well as your justified interests have been taken. Regarding the cases referred to in (1) and (3), the data controller will take appropriate measures to protect rights and freedoms as well as your justified interests, which includes at least the right of a person of [sic] the data controller to take influence, to present own standpoints and to challenge the decision.
dataPrivacy.rightsSection10: 10. Right to complain with a supervisory authority
dataPrivacy.rightsSection10Info: Without prejudice to other administrative or in-court appeal, you have the right to complain with a supervisory authority, in particular in the Member State of your domicile, your workplace or the place of the suspected violation if you believe that the processing of personal data relating to you violates the GDPR. The supervisory authority with which complaint has been filed will inform the complainant of the status and the results of the complaint including the possibility of appeal in court pursuant to Art. 78 GDPR.
